elements.description:
`xf-form`
an xformish form framework for eXist-db.

'xf-form' is the main component of the client-side part of Fore. Just like an HTML form it wraps the controls
belonging to the form. A complete form consists of a server-side part (the modelData) and a client-side part.

On the client the modelData is represented in JSON which reflects the structure of the modelData-bindings. Value updates and
simple validations are conducted on the client directly. Second-level validation and submissions are executed on the
server.

While the data-modelData can be directly inlined within the HTML it will never be exposed to the client at runtime.

 # * @polymer

methods.name: update
methods.description:
updates the model data. As we have limited capabilities on the client _update serves the purpose of the
`rebuild`, `recalculate` and `revalidate` function of XForms.

methods.name: _modelReady
methods.description: called after `model-ready` event fired to signal that all model initialization is complete.

methods.name: resolveProxy
methods.description:
find a proxy for given bindId

First checks wether a proxy is already present and just returning that if it exists
If no proxy is present consult the parent for a proxy and check for bindId within its context.
Continue upwards until 'xf-form' element is reached.

methods.name: createBindProxy
methods.description: get or create a proxy object for given `bind`, `boundElement` and `index`

methods.name: _attachListenerToNativeControls
methods.description: Attaches eventlisteners to bound controls to report back value-changes triggered by the user.

methods.name: _applyPropertiesToNativeControls
methods.description: applies the properties of the bind object to the control.

elements.name: XfForm

events.name: listener
events.description: called after `model-ready` event fired to signal that all model initialization is complete.

elements.description:
`xf-form`
an xformish form framework for eXist-db.

'xf-form' is the main component of the client-side part of Fore. Just like an HTML form it wraps the controls
belonging to the form. A complete form consists of a server-side part (the modelData) and a client-side part.

On the client the modelData is represented in JSON which reflects the structure of the modelData-bindings. Value updates and
simple validations are conducted on the client directly. Second-level validation and submissions are executed on the
server.

While the data-modelData can be directly inlined within the HTML it will never be exposed to the client at runtime.

 # * @polymer

properties.name: modelData
properties.description: The modelData are the parsed JSON data that are returned from the server.

methods.name: _itemAppended
methods.description: this is just a first non-optimized implemenation. Whenever an append has happened a full UI refresh is done.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
updates the model data. As we have limited capabilities on the client _update serves the purpose of the
`rebuild`, `recalculate` and `revalidate` function of XForms.

methods.name: _modelReady
methods.description: called after `model-ready` event fired to signal that all model initialization is complete.

methods.name: findById
methods.description: searches the modelData for given bindId and returns the object.

staticMethods.name: isBoundComponent
staticMethods.description:
checks wether an element is bound or not. A bound element is can be updated from its modelItem.

Note: actions are not bound elements though they have a binding expression. However they do not receive updates
on state changes etc.

elements.name: XfForm

attributes.name: model-data
attributes.description: The modelData are the parsed JSON data that are returned from the server.

events.name: listener
events.description: called after `model-ready` event fired to signal that all model initialization is complete.

methods.name: attachListeners
methods.description:
attaches eventlisteners that update the uiState after user-interaction.

As this varies between controls the respective control must override this.

methods.name: attachListeners
methods.description:
attaches eventlisteners that update the uiState after user-interaction.

As this varies between controls the respective control must override this.

elements.description:
`xf-repeat-item`

A xf-repeat-item is a wrapper around each entry within a repeat. It gets created during init of `xf-repeat`.

methods.name: init
methods.description:
xf-repeat-item is special. Though it gets a modelItem through its parent repeat it is not a BoundElement
itself. Like bound elements it has an `init` method but it's not inherited. It does not get its modelItem
passed in but searches it within its own scope.

methods.name: refresh
methods.description: when xf-repeat-item is refreshed it in turn refreshes all of its bound children.

elements.name: XfRepeatItem
